文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_003_chunk1
证据片段: Creep tests were carried out on specimens machined from heavily cold-worked Zircaloy-2 sheet material in both the rolling (longitudinal) and thickness (short-transverse) directions

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_003_chunk1
证据片段: The texture of the sheet was such that the majority of grains had basal-plane normals oriented 30 deg from the sheet-normal direction

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_003_chunk1
证据片段: The creep tests were carried out in the range 100 to 350 C on both as-received (cold-worked) and annealed material

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_003_chunk1
证据片段: at lower stresses the texture had very little effect on creep either in cold-worked material throughout the temperature range investigated

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_003_chunk1
证据片段: or in annealed materials between 250 and 310 C

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_003_chunk1
证据片段: In annealed materials tested at temperatures below 250 and above 310 C the longitudinal specimens had higher creep rates than the short-transverse ones

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_003_chunk1
证据片段: The material exhibited strong dynamic strain aging which reached maximum intensity around 300 C

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_003_chunk1
证据片段: Optical and electron microscope investigations of crept specimens revealed the formation of kink bands and a cell structure, especially in heavily deformed specimens, but little or no twinning
